Portrait of Dr. L von Schorn

value: The half-length figure of the sitter faces left, turned half frontally. He wears a heavy cape with a chain from the collor. Inscribed below, center: DR. L.v.SCHORN."; lower left: "B. Nehrr del. 1839"; lower right: "J. Thaeter sc."

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of the book dealer, Frèedrich Cristoph Perthes (1772-1843), shown facing half left. He wears a stock and high collar. Inscribed below center (imitation signature): "Frèedrich Perthes", and lower left: "Otto Spekter gez."; lower right: "J. Thaeter gest."

value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

value: Bust portrait of a middle-aged man, seen frontally, wearing a dark stock. His coat is shown in outline only.

label: Description
value: Two heads of an elderly man, left, and an elderly woman, right, facing each other. They both wear close-fitting hats. Inscribed above, left: "W. Leibl 1874" and right: "W. Leible 74".

label: Physical description
value: Etching in dark brown ink on paper, mounted

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In a broad landscape three windmills are seen in the left foreground and middle distance. Peasants and carts in a road in the foreground. Inscribed below, lower left: "Brüghel pinxit." and lower right: "W. Hollar fecit, 1650, Ex. Collectione Arundeliana".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Within a tondo appears Raphael's well-known "Madonna of the Chair" in the Pitti Palace, Florence.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In a wooded landscape, a plank bridge spans a low waterfall. In the right foreground, a large tree, beyond which is a church steeple and figures in a rowboat.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Facing frontally, her gaze directed to the right, Anne, Princess of Orange (1709-1759) is shown with pearls entwined in her hair and an ermine robe over her left shoulder; curtain to right.

label: Physical description
value: Mezzzotint engraving in dark brown ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
King James II of England (after Kneller)

label: Description
value: Half-length, standing slightly to the left, James II of England (1633-1701) is seen in wig, lace cravat and armor. Oval format. Inscribed below: Jacobus II dus D. G. Aug. Sco. Fra et Hib Rex. G. Kneller pinx: I. Beckett fec. Sold by I. Beckett at the golden head in the old Baily.

label: Physical description
value: Mezzotint engraving in dark brown ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The view is taken from the Thames River looking at the principle façade of the Custom House. Various Shallops and other ships in the foreground. Inscribed below: The Custom House.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
The Embarkation of the Princess of Wales

label: Description
value: A flagship and numerous gunboats salute two Royal barges, one bearing the Princess of Wales. A tuch landscape in the background. Inscribed in lower margin: "The Embarkation of the Princess of Wales […?]."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
Ancient View of St. James's and Westminster Abbey, London

label: Description
value: The scene shows meadows, walled in. In the right middle distance is the medieval pile of St. James's Palace, and in the center distance is Westminster Abbey in unfinished state. Locality indications given below, and at top: "An Ancient View of St. James's, Westminster Abbey and Hell, etc, from the Village of Charing, now Charing Cross."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The v iew is taken looking across the river midway toward the city of Rochester, with the cathedral and keep in center middle distance. At the extreme left a strone bridge crosses the river. Inscribed in the margin: "A View of Rochester / Sold by R. Marshall at No. 4 in Aldermary Church yard London."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Panoramic view of the Tower of London and buildings surrounding it, as seen from the far bank of the Thames River. Numerous small craft ply the river. Inscribed in bottom margin: "The Tower of London". In the upper right corner, the number "64".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
The East Front of the Horse and the Foot Guards at Whitehall

label: Description
value: The eastern elevation of the main façade of the Horsegaurds, London, facing the Mall. Inscribed below: "The East Front of the Horse and Foot Guards at Whitehall"; at upper right, the number "65".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Principal elevation of the Mansion House, official residence of the Lord Mayor of London. Inscribed lower right marging: "B. Cole Sculps."; below: "The MANSION HOUSE for the Reception of the LORD MAYOR of the CITY of LONDON for the time Being."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The Holy Family is shown grouped under a palm tree. The child Jesus rests his hand on the palm of Joseph's. Lower left, a cherub holds an ointment jar, while four others gather palms in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957; Acquired by Museum
Plans for the New London Bridge

label: Description
value: Two schemes for a new London Bridge are shown in elevation and half grund plan. Views separated by three double lines of explanation, together with the date.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
The Two Houses of Parliament, from Harrison's History of London

label: Description
value: View of the hold House of Lords right, and of the old House of Commons (left). Inscribed below, lower right: "View of the Office of Ordnance with the Entrance of the HOUSE OF LORDS"; lower left: "View of the HOUSE OF COMMONS from the River Thames"; above: "Engraved for HARRISONS'S History of London".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
The Queen's Palace in St. James's Park, from Walter Harrison's History of London

label: Description
value: The view is taken from St. James's Park, London, with St. James's Palace (designated the "Queens' Palace") in the background. Varoius figures in the foreground. Inscribed below: "THE QUEEN'S PALACE in St. James's Park"; above: "Engraved for Harrisons' History of London, Etc."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
View of Twickenham, from the River Thames, from Walter Harrison's History of London

label: Description
value: The view is taken looking across sthe Thames River, with the town of Twickenham (Berkshire) on the opposite bank. A pleasure craft with figures in the foreground. Inscribed below: "View of TWICKENHAM from the river," and at the top: "Engraved for Harrison's History of London, Etc."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
View of Richmond, from the River Thames, from Walter Harrison's History of London

label: Description
value: The view is taken looking down the River Thames, with the town of Richmond (Berkshire) in the background. A country house in the left foreground. Inscribed below: "View of RICHMOND from the River," and at the top: "Engraved for Harrison's History of London." Inscribed lower right corner: "Royce sc."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
View of Hampton Court from the Thames River, from Walter Harrison's History of London

label: Description
value: The view is taken looking down the Thames River, which is spanned in the middle distance by a wooden bridge. In the left distance appear the buildings of Hampton Court Palace. Inscribed below: "View of HAMPTON COURT from the River", and at top: "engraved for Harrison's History of London, etc."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
Views Representing the Most Considerable Transactions in the Siege of a Place, from Twelve of the Most REmarkable Sieges and Battles in Europe

label: Description
value: Soldiers are seen capturing outlying fortifications before a town. Ships at sea, left distance. Inscribed below: "Views, representing the most considerable TRANSACTIONS in the SIEGE OF A PLACE", followed by a two-line description, and below: "Printed for and Sold by Carington Bowles, at his Map and Print Warehosue, No. 69 in St. Paul's Church Yard, London". In the upper left corner: "Book 24"; upper right: "1".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
Of Making Sallies, and the Method of Repulsing them, from Twelve of the Most Remarkable Sieges and Battles in Europe

label: Description
value: Soldiers are seen in formation making sallies from a fort thrown up before a town. Wounded being collected in the foreground. Inscribed below: "Of making SALLIES, and the method of repulsing them", followed by a two-line description, and below: "printed for and sold by Carington Bowles, at his Map and Print Warehouse, No. 69 in St. Paul's Church Yard, London"; in the upper right corner, the number "2".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
An Attack and Lodgement on the Covert Way, from Twelve of the Most Remarkable Sieges and Battles in Europe

label: Description
value: Soldiers are seen throwing up an earthen bulwark before a town. Inscribed below: "An ATTACK and LODGEMENT on the COVERT WAY", followed by a two-line description, and below: "printed for and Sold by Carington Bowles, at his Map and Print Warehouse, No. 69 in St. Paul's Church yard, London". Inscribed in the upper right corner, the number "3".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
The Attach of Two Bastions, at Breches Made by Springing Mines, from Twelve of the Most Remarkable Sieges and Battles in Europe

label: Description
value: Soldiers are entering a bastion in the foreground, the walls having been broken in at least three places. A town in the background. Inscribed in lower margin: "THE ATTACK of TWO BASTIONS, AT BREACHES MADE BY SPRINGING MINES", followed by a two-line description, and below: "Printed for and sold by Carington Bowles, at his Map and Print Warehouse, No. 69 in St. Paul's Church Yard, London". In the upper right corner, the number "4".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
The Holy Family with a Sack

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Within a lunette, the Virgin and Child are seen seated, while St. Joseph, reclining against a sack, reads to them. Below, the Grand Ducal arms of Tuscany and two line Latin dedicatory inscription. Lower left: "Andreas Sarto pinxit," and lower right: "Ferdinandus Gregorius incid. 1760."
A General Assault from Twelve of the Most Remarkable Sieges and Battles in Europe

label: Description
value: A panoramic view of a city, with soldiers entering through a ruined fortress in the foreground. Naval brigs fire from a harbor, left distance. Inscribed in the lower margin: "A GENERAL ASSAULT", followed by a three-line description, and below: "Printed for and sold by Carington Bowles, at his Map and Print Warehouse, No. 69 in St. Paul's Church Yard, London". In the upper right corner, the number "5".

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker, Yonkers, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A mounted general salutes his officers in the foreground. In the distance massed troops in formation are in battle. Ships in the left distance.

label: Provenance
value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
The Battle of Lowoschutz in Bohemia

label: Description
value: Troops are massed in battle in the background. In the foreground, two cannons, wounded, and dead.

value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum
The Battle of newmarket, in Silesia

label: Description
value: Troops are massed in battle in the foreground and in the background. A cavalry encounter in the immediate foreground.

value: Mr. and Mrs. Bruno Lasker; 1957: Acquired by Museum

View of the Tuilleries Palace, Paris

label: Description
value: The view is taken looking at the principal façade of the Tuilleries Palace, with the enclosed court in the foreground. Troops drilling in the court.

label: Description
value: Fishermen are seen in the foreground below a waterfall. A high cliff in left middle distance.

value: Strollers and a coach are seen on a highway leading toward a village in the distance.
